intro: Ceropegia ampliata subsp. madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and succulent stems. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant.
